content: milkshake a plain toe up sock designed to show off some of the gorgeous variegated yarns that indie dyers are producing just now requirements size s m l 7 8 9 /18cm 20 5cm 23cm in sock weight gauge - swatch 4 x 4 10cm x 10cm 32 sts and 42 row gauge knitted in the round washed and lightly blocked yarn used - sock weight - 1 skein the knitting swede stride in mini rainbow/grey 75% wool/25% nylon 100g - 425m approx needles - sock weight - 2 5mm needles of your choice 2 x 40cm circular needles 80cm or above circular needle for magic loop or dpns abbreviations k knit p purl m1r make 1 right pick up bar of yarn between the needles from the back with the left needle and knit through the front m1l make 1 left pick up bar of yarn between the needles from the front with the left needle and knit through the back sl1 slip 1 purlwise with yarn at back ssk slip 1 stitch as if to knit slip 2nd stitch as if to knit insert the left needle into the front loops of the slipped stitches and knit them together p2tog purl 2 together pm place marker slm slip marker round round ©chork n drum 2017 this pattern must not be copied or distributed toe using judy s magic cast on http //www knitty com/issuespring06/featmagiccaston html or preferred cast on for toe up socks cast on 28 32 36 stitches evenly over needles round 1 knit 14 16 18 pm knit 14 16 18 pm the second set of sts will be knit through the back of loop if using 2 circular needles do not place markers but distribute sts evenly over 2 needles round 2 *k1 m1r knit to 1 stitch before marker m1l k1 slm repeat from * to end of round round 3 knit slm as required to end of round repeat row 2 and 3 until you have 28 32 36 stitches between each marker total 56 64 72 stitches finishing with round 3 foot knit until total length of sock is 2 ½ 6 5cm shorter than the length of your foot finishing at the beginning of a row gusset round 1 work instep sts slm k1 m1r knit to 1 stitch before marker m1l k1 round 2 knit all stitches repeat row 1 and 2 until you have 48 56 64 stitches on the sole finishing with row 2 heel turn work instep sts you will now knit back and forth over the sole stitches only until the heel turn is complete row 1 k27 31 35 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl1 p7 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 k8 ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1 p9 p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 working 1 stitch more each row until all stitches have been used up sole stitches should now equal 28 32 36 stitches leg recommence knitting in the
